dogecoin.text:
A lot of people talking about Bitcoin, Dogecoin, Ethereum and other cryptocurrencies' benefits but not enough emphasis been put on security issues. 

Buying any sort of cryptocurrency involves risk.

Dogecoin is more like DASH or Bitcoin Cash, where the express goal is a spending currency.

I must also strongly note that dogecoin hasn’t had the same security and code-level scrutiny that Bitcoin or Ethereum has. 

So don't cry if you get a mining level attack. 🙂

Is Dogecoin a decent investment?

Very risky. The gains in Dogecoin that have been seen in 2021 may not be sustainable over the longer term. Nobody can guarantee the crypto’s tipping and donating culture.

If you would like to compare the stats:

* It takes 10 minutes for the process to ratify new blocks on the Bitcoin blockchain.
* It takes only one minute on the Dogecoin blockchain

Is Dogecoin similar to Bitcoin? Yes, and no. 

It's more efficient.

Dogecoin is quicker and easier for miners to complete the mathematical equations that complete and record transactions on the transactions.

Despite Dogecoin's comical background, it has exploded in popularity in 2021. It has become the fifth largest cryptocurrency by market cap.

Among its boosters is Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who called Dogecoin his favorite cryptocurrency. 

https://t.co/vYbk5PbfWD

I've noticed a lot of people talking about #dogecoin without knowing it's actual purpose.

Dogecoin was originally created as a lighthearted joke for crypto enthusiasts, and took its name from a once-popular meme. https://t.co/OYKouSTe8x

Over the course of the week, bitcoin has now lost some 25% of its value, amid concerns about new regulation – not only in China but elsewhere too.

The losses have been even more dramatic in some of the smaller coins. Ethereum has lost almost 40%, and dogecoin is down by a third.
